name: qexmid

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wi(w0, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, wal(s0, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wi(w0, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wex(s0, wal(s0, w0)))

comment: Quantified excluded middle (see ~ exmid ). Also known as the drinker paradox (if ` ph ( x ) ` is interpreted as " ` x ` drinks", then this theorem tells that there exists a person such that, if this person drinks, then everyone drinks). Exercise 9.2a of Boolos, p. 111, _Computability and Logic_. (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2000.)
